quotes.text: The idea which I have never ceased to develop is that in the end one is always responsible for what is made of one. Even if one can do nothing else besides assume this responsibility. For I believe that a man can always make something out of what is made of him. This is the limit I would today accord to freedom: the small movement which makes of a totally conditioned social being someone who does not render back completely what his conditioning has given him.
quotes.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quotes.text: 过去一家人碰到一块，说闲话的时候多。现在不是，到一块就是辩论无产阶级文化大革命的问题。父子之间、兄弟姐妹之间、夫妻之间，连十几岁娃娃和老太大，都参加了辩论。
quotes.translation: In the past, when a family gathered, they spent most of the time chatting casually. That's not the case anymore. Now, whenever they come together, it's to debate the issues of the Proletarian Cultural Revolution. Between fathers and sons, brothers and sisters, husbands and wives—even kids in their teens and elderly grandmothers—everyone joins the debate.
quotes.source: 毛主席视察华北、中南和华东地区时的重要指示
quotes.source_translation: The Important Instructions Given by Chairman Mao During His Inspections of North China, Central-South China, and East China

quotes.text: The only way to represent the infinite objects in a finite way is using quantificational logic over tight symbolic structures. That's why neural networks cannot do basic arithmetic. You need intensions that are symbolic procedures over variables.

quotes.translation: We are like patient gardeners, tending to a weed-filled garden. We must have watchful eyes and gentle hands. Be careful, son — at this moment, I am placing a wax tablet in your brain like a phonograph record before recording, and I am etching the first groove on it...

quotes.text: And indeed, a reader is hard pressed to even think of a Chinese term for fictionality. The closest term from literary analysis may be xugouxing, but this term didn’t come into use in Chinese literary discourse until the 1990s, and is hence anachronistic.

La guerre des noms propres suit l’arrivée de l’étranger et l’on ne s’en étonnera pas. Elle naît en présence et même de la présence de l’ethnographe qui vient déranger l’ordre et la paix naturelle, la complicité qui lie pacifiquement la bonne société à soi-même dans son jeu.
quotes.translation: The battle of proper names follows the arrival of the foreigner and one will not be surprised by it. It is born in the presence and even from the presence of the anthropologist who comes to disturb order and natural peace, the complicity which peacefully binds the good society to itself in its play.

quotes.text: To set aside the sympathy we extend to others beset by war and murderous politics for a reflection on how our privileges are located on the same map as their suffering, and may—in ways we might prefer not to imagine—be linked to their suffering, as the wealth of some may imply the destitution of others, is a task for which the painful, stirring images supply only an initial spark.
人在痛苦和孤独的时候总会想起故乡，总爱去重温童年欢乐和温暖的梦；作为画家，永生难忘的还有那丰富的光影、色彩、轮廓和线条...
quotes.translation: In moments of pain and loneliness, one's thoughts drift back to home, to the tender joys and warm dreams of childhood. For a painter, unforgettable too are the textures of light and shadow, the hues, the contours, and the lines...
quotes.source: Bai Hua 白桦, "Bitter Love" 《苦恋》

quotes.text: I shall never forget how I was roused one night by the groans of a fellow prisoner, who threw himself about in his sleep, obviously having a horrible nightmare. Since I had always been especially sorry for people who suffered from fearful dreams or deliria, I wanted to wake the poor man. Suddenly I drew back the hand which was ready to shake him, frightened at the thing I was about to do. At that moment I became intensely conscious of the fact that no dream, no matter how horrible, could be as bad as the reality of the camp which surrounded us, and to which I was about to recall him.

And then it becomes 1990. I'm forty-three years old, and a writer now, still dreaming Linda alive in exactly the same way. She's not the embodied Linda; she's mostly made up, with a new identity and a new name, like the man who never was. Her real name doesn't matter. She was nine years old. I loved her and then she died. And yet right here, in the spell of memory and imagination, I can still see her as if through ice, as if I'm gazing into some other world, a place where there are no brain tumors and no funeral homes, where there are no bodies at all. I can see Kiowa, too, and Ted Lavender and Curt Lemon, and sometimes I can even see Timmy skating with Linda under the yellow floodlights. I'm young and happy. I'll never die. I'm skimming across the surface of my own history, moving fast, riding the melt beneath the blades, doing loops and spins, and when I take a high leap into the dark and come down thirty years later, I realize it is as Tim trying to save Timmy's life with a story.
嗑着瓜子聽戲的菊仙有點蒼白失措。但她沒有其他人骨酥筋軟那麼窩囊。她一個女子，還是坐得好好的，不動。小樓給她作了一個“不要怕”的手勢示意，她眼神中交錯着複雜的情緒。本來猶有餘悸，因他在，他叫她不要怕，她的心安定下來了。
quotes.translation: Juxian, who had been snacking on melon seeds while watching the opera, looked pale and flustered. Yet, she was not as spinelessly pathetic as the others, who had gone limp with fear. A woman, she nevertheless remained seated perfectly upright, motionless. Xiaolou gave her a reassuring gesture, a silent "don't be afraid." A complex tangle of emotions played across her eyes. Though the aftershocks of fear still lingered, the sight of him—and his telling her not to be afraid—allowed her heart to finally settle.
quotes.source_detail: Farewell My Concubine 霸王別姬

quotes.text: 她說，值了，我這一輩子活得值了，讓我劉蓮現在死了，我也心甘啦。
quotes.translation: She said, “It’s worth it. My whole life has been worth it. Now, even if I, Liu Lian, die, I’ll have no regrets.”

quotes.text: "You should have seen the look on my father's face when I told him. My mother actually fainted. My sisters splashed her face with water. They fanned her and looked at me as if I had slit her throat. My brother Jalal actually went to fetch his hunting rifle before my father stopped him." Rahim Khan barked a bitter laughter. "It was Homaira and me against the world. And I'll tell you this, Amir jan: In the end, the world always wins."
